moves.1. e4 c5 2. Bc4 e6 3. Nf3: 3. Nf3 for white doesn't seem like white's best play in this situation.  It allows black to play 3...d5 which will force the bishop to eventually move.
moves.3... d5 4. exd5 exd5 5. Bb3: Didn't expect to see this at all.  I was expecting either Bb5+ or a retreat to Be2.
moves.5... b5: This is poor move from me.  Thankfully my opponent didn't play 6. Qe2+ because I would've dropped that pawn I advanced.
moves.6. c3 c4 7. Bc2 Nf6: Maybe a stronger move here would've been Bg4 pinning the knight?
moves.8. d3 Bg4 9. O-O Nc6 10. dxc4 bxc4 11. B: Although my queen is protecting my pinned knight now, she's also eying down the h2 square and, hopefully I'm able to get my bishop to d6 so I can possibly snatch the pawn on h2 after Bxf3.
moves.12. Qd4 Bxf3 13. Bf4 Bd6 14. Re1+ Be4 15: Had my opponent seen this, he could have had a draw here.  I shouldn't have captured on a2.....Maybe Kg8 or h5 to give my king an outlet to avoid the draw.
